page.title: 09Mortimer Farm + Nature Trail
page.content: The fruit farm was previously a country estate. Coming into the farm you see goats and ducks and the farm shop. There is a playground with apparatus made of tree trunks and rope. Cream teas are sold in an old cow-shed. The farm grows strawberries, raspberries, currants, tayberries, gooseberries and grapes. People pick their own fruit and pay at the shop. Many local families help with the summer picking for market. Behind the farm is woodland which forms part of the childrens nature trail. Along this trail you could see goldfinches, woodpeckers, blackbirds, thrushes and yellow-hammers. There are many butterflies and some beehives. Tucked away is an old ice-house of brick. People from the house kept their food cool in summer by filling it in winter with ice from the pond.
